Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% internal positions must be calibrated
Description:
Ensure that all open positions are calibrated to allow candidates/employees to receive relevant job recommendations

Impact of failure
. Missing calbiration may lead to job recommendations that are not aligned with an candidate / employee's experience and background reducing relevance and quality of Matches

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% internal positions must have a location
Description:
Ensure that all open positions have a location assigned to allow employees to receive relevant job recommendations based on geographic preferences.

Impact of failure
. Missing location data may lead to job recommendations that are not aligned with an employee's preferred or eligible locations, reducing relevance and quality of Matches

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% internal positions must have skills
Description:
Ensure that positions have at least one skill assigned to support relevant job recommendations based on employee skill sets.

Impact of failure
. Without any skills assigned, the system cannot accurately match employees to roles, resulting in low-quality or irrelevant recommendations.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% internal positions must have more than 3 skills
Description:
Ensure that all open positions have atleast 3 skills assigned to enable more precise and high-quality job recommendations.

Impact of failure
. Inadequate skill tagging can reduce the accuracy of recommendations and hinder the system's ability to distinguish between relevant and irrelevant matches.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% internal positions must have job bands that are defined in internal job posting (IJP) config
Description:
Ensure that positions have a job band assigned to enable relevant job recommendations based on seniority alignment.

Impact of failure
. Missing job band data can result in mismatches between job seniority and employee experience, reducing recommendation effectiveness.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% claimed employee profiles must have level defined in ijp_config
Description:
Ensure that employee profiles have a job level assigned to enable job recommendations aligned with the employee's seniority.

Impact of failure
. Recommendations may be too junior or senior for the employee's current position, reducing their usefulness and relevance. Additionally missing job level information prevents the system from aligning employees with mentors at the appropriate seniority level, leading to mismatches and reduced mentoring impact.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% claimed employee profiles must have skills
Description:
Ensure that employee profiles include skills to support relevant job/course recommendations based on capabilities and expertise.

Impact of failure
. Absence of skill data can lead to generic or irrelevant recommendations that don't reflect the employee's abilities.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have more than 3 skills
Description:
Ensure that projects have atleast 3 relevant skills assigned to enable accurate and high-quality employee matches.

Impact of failure
. Limited skill data on projects can reduce matching precision, leading to inefficient resource allocation.
Updates to rule logic (If needed): specific about the number of skills

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have ideal candidates
Description:
Ensure that projects have at least three ideal candidate assigned to improve the quality of employee matching.

Impact of failure
. Without an ideal candidate reference, matching may not reflect actual expectations for the role.
Updates to rule logic (If needed): logic update: Instead of one ideal candidate make it three

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have location
Description:
Ensure that projects have a location assigned to support relevant employee matches based on geography.

Impact of failure
. Employees may be recommended for projects in unsuitable locations, impacting assignment success.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have more than 3 skills
Description:
Ensure that projects have more than three skills assigned to support high-quality and precise employee matching.

Impact of failure
Projects with too few skills may lead to inaccurate or generic matches, lowering project success and efficiency.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have ideal candidates
Description:
Ensure that each project has at least three candidate assigned to guide high-quality employee recommendations.

Impact of failure
Without an ideal candidate reference, the system lacks a benchmark for fit, resulting in mismatches and reduced match confidence
Updates to rule logic (If needed): logic update: Instead of one ideal candidate make it three

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% projects must have location
Description:
Ensure that each project has a location assigned to support relevant employee recommendations based on geography.

Impact of failure
Employee-project matches may ignore geographic constraints, leading to impractical or undesirable recommendations.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have skills
Description:
Ensure courses have skills present to support accurate course-to-skill matching.

Impact of failure
. Courses without skill tags can't be effectively matched to employee development needs, reducing recommendation quality.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of courses should have relevant (50+ words) description
Description:
Ensure courses have adequate descriptions (minimum 50 words) to make the reccomendation appropriate.

Impact of failure
. Lack of context about the course due to Incomplete descriptions or no descriptions decrease the quality of course recommendation

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have their associated levels defined in Internal mobility config
Description:
Define levels in internal mobility configuration to establish a clear role hierarchy across the organization.

Impact of failure
. Without defined levels, the system cannot accurately interpret progression paths or seniority alignment, leading to invalid career path recommendations

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have job code
Description:
Job codes act as unique identifiers to determine distinct roles and associate employees accurately with them.

Impact of failure
. Missing or inconsistent job codes lead to incorrect role mappings and invalid career path recommendations

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have business function
Description:
Assign business functions to roles to infer domain and improve recommendation relevance in Career Navigator.

Impact of failure
. Without business function context, the system may misunderstand role intent, affecting domain-specific guidance.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of roles should have at least 3 skills
Description:
Skills and benchmarks help define role requirements and power recommendations in key TM modules like Career Navigator.

Impact of failure
. Poorly defined role requirements hinder accurate skill gap identification and reduce the value of personalized suggestions.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}%  of claimed employee profiles should have marked as open to mentorship
Description:
Ensure a sufficient number of mentors are available to support relevant mentor recommendations for employees.

Impact of failure
. Too few mentors can limit access and degrade the quality of mentorship matching.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% mentor profiles must have rich data
Description:
Ensure mentor profiles have rich data to allow the system to make high-quality mentor recommendations.

Impact of failure
. Incomplete mentor profiles reduce relevance and engagement in mentorship programs.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% claimed employee profiles must have skills
Description:
Ensure that claimed employee profiles have skills assigned to enable employees to receive relevant mentor recommendations based on their learning and growth needs.

Impact of failure
Without skills in employee profiles, the system cannot recommend mentors with the right expertise, reducing the effectiveness and relevance of mentor-mentee matches.

Rule Name: Do not Publish jobs posted on the sandbox PCS Site to Google/Search Engines
Description: Ensure we prevent candidates from arriving at the sandbox site rather than the production site

Rule Name: Number of external domains allowed for this instance
Description: This rule checks the external_account_for_group_id config to ensure that the number of external domains for this instance is no more than 20

Rule Name: Campaign rate limit
Description: This rule checks that the maximum campaign limit is set to under 2000. This is set in campaign_config under the key 'max_per_campaign' -> group_id

Rule Name: Email loopback should be disabled for prod instance
Description: This rule checks to ensure that email_loopback_gate is disabled for this instance (prod)

Rule Name: Email loopback should be enabled for sandbox instance
Description: This rule checks to ensure that email_loopback_gate is enabled for this instance (non-prod)

Rule Name: Account provisioning should be based on Employee Sync.
Description: This determines which accounts should have accounts provisioned. Only employees whose data has been synced to Eightfold will have accounts created

Rule Name: Session timeout
Description: This determines if the session timeout is less than 24 hours

Rule Name: Profile visibility
Description: Check if unclaimed employee profiles can be viewed by other employees and recruiters.

Rule Name: Too many Candidate Sync Failures
Description: This rule evaluates the health of candidate syncs by tracking the number of sync failures.

Rule Name: Too many Position Sync Failures
Description: This rule evaluates the health of position syncs by tracking the number of sync failures.

Rule Name: Too many Employee Sync Failures
Description: The rule "Too many Employee Sync Failures" activates when the total count of failed synchronizations in a single day exceeds the average failed synchronizations over the last seven days by more than one standard deviation. This method uses statistical analysis to pinpoint unusual activity.

Rule Name: Too many Rejections in the platform
Description: This rule warns if the number of rejections in a single day is unusually high compared to the average over the last seven days, using statistical analysis to detect spikes. This helps identify anomalies that might need investigation.

Rule Name: Too many Application Failures
Description: This rule fails if the total number of application failures in a single day is more than one standard deviation above the average number of failures from the past seven days. This means we use statistics to find unusually high numbers of failures.

Rule Name: Too many profiles subject to data retention rules
Description: This rule identifies when the percentage of profiles flagged for data retention exceeds 10% of the total talent pool. This is calculated by dividing the number of profiles subject to data retention by the total talent pool size. The business logic behind this is that once profiles are purged, proactive checks may not be accurate as any activity on those profiles will reset the counter and prevent their deletion.

Rule Name: Too many unsubscribe requests
Description: This rule checks for a high number of unsubscribe requests. We need to clarify what "high" means and if we should also look at why people are unsubscribing, as well as whether the requests are from real people or bots. Also, we need to decide if this rule is still necessary, as unsubscribe requests are often a personal choice and may not impact product security.

Rule Name: Emails sent to employees
Description: This rule needs to be functional. For example, an employee shouldn't receive more than two non-time-sensitive "Skills Update" emails per month. However, this rule should not apply to time-sensitive "Skills Assessment (Self)" requests. This rule is registered as 'emails_sent_to_employees'.

Rule Name: Overall email volume
Description: This rule is for production instances to prevent too many admin accounts. This is important for: 1. Making sure customers can do transactions reliably. 2. Having proper audits for production. 3. Clearly defining who is responsible for what.

Rule Name: Admin accounts
Description: Check if there are too many admin accounts set up in the instance

Rule Name: Data subject requests
Description: Check if there are too many data subject requests set up in the instance

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have level
Description: Employee levels are essential for determining employee seniority and for automatically initializing role seniority. This rule ensures that employee level field is not blank

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location country
Description: This rule ensures that country field is not blank since it is used in analytics dashboards for generating insights and for filtering

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have email
Description: This rule ensures that email field is not blank for the employees since this field is used as a primary key in some of our datasets

Rule Name: Discrepancy between count of employees that are alumni and employees with a termination_date must be less than {{ metric_data_json.discrepancy_threshold }}%
Description: This rule ensures that all employees who have left the organisation have a termination date present

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have first name
Description: This rule ensures that first name must be present for employees

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have last name
Description: This rule ensures that last name must be present for employees

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have hiring_date
Description: This rule ensures that hiring date field is not blank for employees since it is important for analytics dashboard data accuracy

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have location
Description: This rule ensures that location field is not blank for most of the employees

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager_id
Description: This rule ensures that manager's user id field is not blank. The manager_userid field is important for the org chart product to work, as the org chart can only be generated if manager ids

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have manager email
Description: This rule ensures that manager's email field is not blank for employees since this field is used as a filter in some of our datasets

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have lob (Line of Business)
Description: This rule ensures that the divsiion field is not blank. Division (line of business) is important to understand employee's role and for role auto initialisation to infer role business function

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of employees should have internal candidate profile
Description: This rule requires that more than a specified percentage of employees (above a set minimum threshold) have an internal candidate profile within the system, ensuring a strong link between each employee record and an internal candidate profile used for talent management activities.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of profiles should have first_name
Description: This rule ensures that first name must be present for candidates to accurately display names on dashboards and throughout our system

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of profiles should have last_name
Description: This rule ensures that last name must be present for candidates to accurately display names on dashboards and throughout our system

Rule Name: Funnel Metric - There must be more applications in 'new_applicant' stagegroup than 'phonescreen' stagegroup
Description: This metric ensures that the count of applications in 'new_applicant' stagegroup is more than application in 'phonescreen' stagegroup so that the funnel integrity is maintained

Rule Name: Funnel Metric - There must be more applications in 'phonescreen' stagegroup than 'onsite' stagegroup
Description: This metric ensures that the count of applications in 'phonescreen' stagegroup is more than application in 'onsite' stagegroup so that the funnel integrity is maintained

Rule Name: Funnel Metric - There must be more applications in 'onsite' stagegroup than 'offer' stagegroup
Description: This metric ensures that the count of applications in 'onsite' stagegroup is more than application in 'offer' stagegroup so that the funnel integrity is maintained

Rule Name: Funnel Metric - There must be more applications in 'offer' stagegroup than 'hired' stagegroup
Description: This metric ensures that the count of applications in 'offer' stagegroup is more than application in 'hired' stagegroup so that the funnel integrity is maintained

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications should have source_type
Description: This metric ensures that applications must have source_type. This is critical to identify where the application was created from.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications must be in offer stage group
Description: This metric ensures that some applications must be present in offer stage group. In case this metric fails, please check the stages the applications are in, and make sure there are stages in the stagemap mapped to 'offer' stage

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications must be in phonescreen stage group
Description: This metric ensures that some applications must be present in phonescreen stage group. In case this metric fails, please check the stages the applications are in, and make sure there are stages in the stagemap mapped to 'phonescreen' stage

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications must be in new_applicant stage group
Description: This metric ensures that some applications must be present in new applicant stage group. In case this metric fails, please check the stages the applications are in, and make sure there are stages in the stagemap mapped to 'new applicant' stage

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications must be in an onsite/interview stage group
Description: This metric ensures that some applications must be present in onsite stage group. In case this metric fails, please check the stages the applications are in, and make sure there are stages in the stagemap mapped to 'onsite' stage

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of applications must be in hired stage group
Description: This metric ensures that some applications must be present in hired stage group. In case this metric fails, please check the stages the applications are in, and make sure there are stages in the stagemap mapped to 'hired' stage

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have location_country

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have hiring manager name
Description: This metric ensures that HM name must be present for positions. This is important for analytics since this field is used as a filter in some of our dashboards

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have title
Description: This metric ensures that title must be present for positions. This is important for analytics dashboards and is also used in the positions page

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of positions should have business_unit

This metric ensures that is_open fields is correctly mapped and must be present for positions. This is important for analytics since this field is used as a filter in some of our dashboards

Please refer to the Sample Configs to find examples for the 'is_open' custom field mapping. For SuccessFactors refer to 'Sample Successfactors Field Mapping'; For ORC refer to 'Sample (1) ORC Integration System'.

Rule Name: More than {{ metric_data_json.min_threshold }}% of posted positions should have job_function

Rule Name: talent_lake_provisioned
Config Reference:
[Purpose] Confirms whether Talent Lake, a key feature of the Talent Intelligence Platform, is provisioned.
[Impact] Without Talent Lake, advanced analytics and talent insights are unavailable, reducing platform utility.
Description: NA

Rule Name: data_retention_config
Config Reference:
[Purpose] Ensures data retention policies are configured to purge or anonymize historical candidate data as per compliance requirements, including GDPR, CCPA, and other applicable privacy regulations. A minimum of one data retention rule must be defined for the talent pool present in Eightfold to ensure proper data lifecycle management.
[Impact] Non-compliance with data privacy laws could result in legal risks, regulatory penalties, and data mismanagement. Inadequate data retention policies may lead to unnecessary data storage costs and potential security vulnerabilities.
New Feature Alignment: Can be updated to add details for what config keys system is looking for to validate this rule. Example: Minimum 1 rule should be defined for talent pool in eightfold

Rule Name: email_loopback
Config Reference:
[Purpose] Currently email loopback is activated for all sandbox instances. In sandbox environments, this ensures emails are routed back to the logged-in user to prevent real recipients from receiving test notifications. In production environments, the loopback should be disabled to allow emails to be sent to actual candidates and interviewers. To facilitate email flow testing without sending emails to unintended recipients, please setup loopback_whitelisted_recipient_emails configuration. By adding tester emails to this list, you can ensure that only specified addresses receive the emails, enhancing testing accuracy and security.
[Impact] Failure to enable email loopback in sandbox environments can result in test emails being sent to real recipients, causing confusion and potential data privacy issues. Conversely, if enabled in production, actual recipients will not receive critical notifications. Please read more here: https://docs.eightfold.ai/integration/enhanced-email-loopback
New Feature Alignment: Add the config key or gate required for this functionality. This should work by default unless overwritten by a config/gate

Rule Name: oauth_enabled
Config Reference:
[Purpose] Ensures integrations utilize OAuth authentication when supported by the adaptor to enhance security posture and reduce credential exposure risks
[Impact] Using OAuth provides enhanced security through token-based authentication, automatic token refresh capabilities, and reduced risk of credential compromise. Failure to implement OAuth where supported may result in security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, and increased maintenance overhead for credential management.
New Feature Alignment: This is rule checks whether Integrations is using Oauth for connection. Add the supported adaptors names only

Product Area: Hired stage group mapping should be set up in stagemap
Rule Name: stagemap_hired
Config Reference: This rule ensures that the hired stage group mapping is set up in ATS config stagemap. The hired stage group must be defined to evaluate the 'Average Days to Hire' metric and crucial for identifying candidates as 'hired'.

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for application.reason field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_application_reason
Config Reference:
Config Key: custom_fields_v2_application_reason
Description
This health rule validates that the application.reason field is properly configured in the Custom Fields V2 mapping for your ATS integration. The application.reason field captures rejection reasons when candidates are moved to rejection stages in the hiring workflow.
What It Checks
Verifies that custom_fields_v2 > application > reason is configured in your Integration System
Ensures the mapping correctly extracts rejection reason data from your source ATS
Why It Matters
Proper configuration of the application.reason field is critical for:
Talent Analytics & Reporting
Rejection reason data populates the rejection_reason field in the Data Warehouse (Application table)
Powers analytics dashboards and hiring funnel reports
Enables rejection reason trend analysis over time
AI Model Training
Rejection reasons are used in Outcome Data classification
Helps distinguish between "not screened" vs "not qualified" rejection types
Improves candidate scoring and recommendation accuracy
Workflow Automation
Enables rejection reason-based triggers in Workflow Automation Center
Allows custom actions based on specific rejection reasons
Supports compliance and auditing requirements
Candidate Experience
Proper tracking ensures rejection reasons are available for candidate communications
Maintains historical context for re-applications
Impact of Missing Configuration
Without this mapping:
Rejection reason data will not flow from your ATS to Eightfold
Analytics reports will show blank/null values for rejection reasons
Outcome data classification accuracy may be reduced
Workflow automation rules based on rejection reasons will not trigger

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for position.recruiter field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_position_recruiter
Config Reference: General custom_fields_v2.position configurations that can include recruiter field mappings to be populated for position details. Also used in screening dashboard and analytics contexts - Workday

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for application.race field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_application_race
Config Reference:
Jobvite: Extracts from race field, filtering out 'Undefined' values
Workday: Extracts from multiple EEOC race/ethnicity reference fields (wd:race, wd:Ethnicity_Reference, wd:Ethnicity)
Standard ATS model: All ATS adapters support the race field
EEOC context: Like other EEOC fields (veteran_status, disability_status, gender), race is typically handled automatically by ATS adapters as part of EEOC compliance requirements rather than requiring custom field mapping.

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for application.gender field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_application_gender
Config Reference:
Jobvite: Extracts from gender field and fallback to customField array
Workday: Extracts from multiple EEOC gender reference fields (wd:gender, wd:Gender_Reference, wd:Gender)
Standard ATS model: All ATS adapters support the gender field
EEOC context: Like other EEOC fields (veteran_status, disability_status), gender is typically handled automatically by ATS adapters rather than requiring custom field mapping.

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for application.disability_status field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_application_disability_status
Config Reference:
SuccessFactors: Uses picklist field disabilityStatus with specific regex patterns
Workday: Extracts from EEOC questionnaire data with built-in logic
Standard ATS model: All ATS adapters support the disability_status boolean field
EEOC context: Like veteran status, disability status is typically handled automatically by ATS adapters as part of EEOC compliance requirements rather than requiring custom field mapping.

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for application.veteran_status field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_application_veteran_status
Config Reference:
Built-in extraction: Multiple ATS adapters have dedicated functions for veteran status extraction:
Jobvite: a.veteran_status = not regex_utils.search(r'^(decline|not)\b', application['veteranStatus'].lower())
SuccessFactors: extract_veteran_status() with regex matching for "I am a protected veteran"
Workday: extract_candidate_veteran_status() from EEOC data

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for candidate.race field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_candidate_race
Config Reference:
Workday extraction: Built-in functions extract race/ethnicity from EEOC data using _get_field_value()
EEOC compliance: Used for Equal Employment Opportunity Commission reporting and diversity tracking
Data sources: Extracted from application questionnaires and EEOC forms

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for candidate.gender field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_candidate_gender
Config Reference:
Workday extraction: Built-in functions extract gender from EEOC data using _get_field_value()
EEOC compliance: Used for Equal Employment Opportunity Commission reporting
Data sources: Extracted from application questionnaires and EEOC forms

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for candidate.disability_status field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_candidate_disability_status
Config Reference:
Workday extraction: Built-in functions extract_candidate_disability_status() in Workday adapters handle disability status extraction
EEOC compliance: Used for Equal Employment Opportunity Commission reporting and accessibility compliance
Data sources: Extracted from application questionnaires and EEOC forms

Product Area: Custom Field mapping for candidate.veteran_status field should be setup
Rule Name: custom_fields_v2_candidate_veteran_status
Config Reference:
Workday extraction: Built-in functions extract_candidate_veteran_status() in Workday adapters handle veteran status extraction
EEOC compliance: Used for Equal Employment Opportunity Commission reporting
Data sources: Extracted from application questionnaires and EEOC forms

Product Area: RAAS List Reports for candidates should be setup
Rule Name: candidate_raas_list_report
Config Reference: Workday extraction: Built-in functions extract_candidate_veteran_status() in Workday adapters handle veteran status extraction

Product Area: RAAS List Reports for positions should be setup
Rule Name: position_raas_list_report
Config Reference: This must be setup to meet the sync lag SLA requirement for the entity_type: position

Rule Name: internal_job_posting_sites
Config Reference:
Purpose: Defines which job board/posting site IDs are classified as internal (employee-only) job postings
Usage: Used alongside external_job_posting_sites to determine if a job posting is internal vs external
ATS systems: Used in Workday and Taleo (same systems as external_job_posting_sites)
Configuration path: enterprise_config → internal_job_posting_sites

Rule Name: external_job_posting_sites
Config Reference:
Purpose: Defines which job board/posting site IDs are classified as external (public) job postings
Usage: Used to determine if a job posting is external vs internal when processing job data
ATS systems: Used in Workday, Taleo, SuccessFactors, and Greenhouse
Default value: ['_external'] for SuccessFactors
Configuration path: enterprise_config → external_job_posting_sites

Product Area: add_application_sources referral source id value should be configured
Rule Name: add_application_sources_referral
Config Reference: add_application_sources_referral maps applications with source_type: 'referral' to a specific value in ATS systems, ensuring referral applications are correctly tagged, while other ATS systems handle referrals differently. -  iCIMS and Jobvite

Product Area: add_application_sources employee source id value should be configured
Rule Name: add_application_sources_employee
Config Reference: add_application_sources_employee maps source_type: 'employee' to a specific value in ATS systems, ensuring internal applications are correctly tagged, - iCIMS and Jobvite

Product Area: add_application_sources applied source id value should be configured
Rule Name: add_application_sources_applied
Config Reference: add_application_sources_applied maps source_type: 'applied' to a specific value in ATS systems, ensuring external applications are correctly tagged, - iCIMS and Jobvite

Product Area: internal_app_regex.source_type in ATS Config should have current worker
Rule Name: internal_app_regex_source_type
Config Reference: This check internal_app_regex_source_type is a configuration parameter that automatically classifies job applications as internal by matching the application's source_type field against a regex pattern (e.g., "internal" or "employee"), affecting analytics, reporting, and workflows, and is configured via integration_systems → [system-id] → internal_app_regex → source_type.

Product Area: career_site_source_id should be set in ats_config to send correct source during application writeback to SF
Rule Name: career_site_source_id
Config Reference: This check career_site_source_id is a configuration parameter that tags applications from the company's career site or job board by setting the source ID in ATS systems ensuring accurate source tracking for applications submitted through PCS, typically configured via career_site_source_id in the ATS system. - SuccessFactors

Rule Name: list_terminated_employees
Config Reference: This check list_terminated_employees is a SuccessFactors-specific configuration flag that controls whether to include terminated/inactive employees when fetching employee data. - SuccessFactors

Rule Name: stage_advance_using_odata
Config Reference: The stage_advance_using_odata flag modernizes your SuccessFactors integration by switching from legacy APIs to the more capable OData API for application stage management operations. - SuccessFactors

Rule Name: hide_skipped_statuses_in_application_trail
Config Reference: The hide_skipped_statuses_in_application_trail rule cleans up the application history by filtering out phantom stages that SuccessFactors automatically creates but that applications never actually visit, providing a more accurate and user-friendly view of the application journey. - SuccessFactor

Product Area: RAAS List Reports for questionnaires should be setup
Rule Name: questionnaire_raas_list_report
Config Reference: This should be configured to auto generate questionnaires along with dependencies, this is useful for (A) customers using smart_apply and want to fetch questions from workday automatically and/or (B) customer needs correct question text to be available in application section of candidate profile(TA)

Product Area: Internal to external candidate conversion rule
Rule Name: internal_to_external_candidate_profile_conversion_rule
Config Reference: This rule succeeds if internal to external candidate conversion is enabled in successfactors (SF). This is not a setting in Eightfold rather needs to be setup in SF. This rule needs manual exemption as there is no automated way to validate if the job is enabled.

Product Area: Reply to shouldn't be set to support@eightfold.ai by default.
Rule Name: reply_to_eightfold_support_email_validation
Config Reference: This rule checks if the default reply to is set support@eightfold.ai. It should be modified to the customer's level 1 admin or support team. Only authorized team members can submit a support ticket to the Eightfold Support team. Consult the account CSM if unsure what email address to place here.
